leaders.bg: William Paterson University dual degrees in Finance and Professional Sales. Studied at Harvard Business School, Stanford GSB (Venture Capital), and Wharton. Angel investor with 67+ investments including Polygon, Chainlink, and Dfinity which crossed $20B+ market cap. Member of Blockchain Investors Consortium managing $6B+ in crypto assets. Also Partner at The Pay It Forward Company. Traveled to 32+ countries.

news.h: Dexly Finance Positions as ISO-First Direct Capital Provider
news.d: Dexly Finance built around speed, transparency, and broker-protected relationships, delivering working capital solutions designed for ISOs and brokers.

news.h: Burkay Kaplan Continues Active Angel Portfolio
news.d: CEO maintains 67+ angel investments across crypto and fintech, with top investments in Polygon, Chainlink, and Dfinity exceeding $20B combined market cap.

leaders.bg: CUNY Brooklyn College graduate. MCA industry veteran who previously worked at All-Star Capital (featured in deBanked red carpet video). Built Aspire Funding Platform with API/OCR-forward approach for fast approvals. Regular attendee at deBanked Broker Fair events including 2024 and 2025 editions. Based in Woodcliff Lake, NJ with 7 employees.
Dual-role managing operations and marketing at Aspire Funding Platform. Oversees day-to-day workflow and ISO partner attraction for the Woodcliff Lake, NJ-based funder.
Leads underwriting team at Aspire Funding Platform. Oversees deal evaluation and approval processes utilizing API and OCR technology for faster decisions.
Hands-on underwriter at Aspire Funding Platform handling daily deal evaluations using the company's API/OCR technology stack.

news.h: Aspire Funding Platform Showcases at deBanked Broker Fair 2025
news.d: CEO Daniel Lenefsky represented Aspire at major industry events, emphasizing the company's technology-driven approach to MCA funding with 24-hour turnaround.

news.h: Aspire Funding Platform Maintains ISO-Focused Growth
news.d: Company continues to leverage advanced technology and experienced underwriters to provide quick approvals and competitive offers for ISO partners.

leaders.bg: Founded Simply Funding in 2017 as a direct MCA funder in Manhattan's financial district. Company has since relocated to Jersey City and grown to 28 employees. Built the company from scratch with ISO-only distribution model, now doing A/B paper with weekly payments.

Joined Simply Funding as a partner in 2021 after transitioning from broker to funder. Previously Head of Operations at Shield Funding and VP of Business Development at Venture Credit Solutions. Featured in deBanked January 2025 profile. Under his leadership, Simply more than doubled funding volume year-over-year for multiple consecutive years. Known for strict data security practices.
Oversees financial strategy, portfolio management, and risk assessment at Simply Funding. Key financial decision-maker for the 28-person Jersey City operation.
Manages all ISO and broker relationships at Simply Funding, which operates exclusively through an ISO distribution channel with no inside sales team.

Touro University graduate. Served as Senior Manager of Funding and Business Development at Simply Funding from September 2021 to August 2023. Founded Radiance Funding in November 2023, where he serves as CEO. Represented Simply at deBanked events. Radiance offers same-day approvals and purchases future receivables.

news.h: A Glimpse at Simply Funding — deBanked Profile
news.d: In-depth profile featuring Jacob Kleinberger discussing company growth, A/B paper model, and plans for 2025. Company doubled funding volume year-over-year for multiple consecutive years.

news.h: Simply Funding Sponsors deBanked Broker Fair
news.d: Simply Funding served as sponsor at deBanked Broker Fair, signaling continued investment in ISO community relationships.

news.h: ACHWorks and Onyx IQ Partner to Power Simply Funding
news.d: Simply Funding partnered with ACHWorks for payment processing and Onyx IQ for lending workflow automation, building tech-forward operational infrastructure.

leaders.bg: Decades of MCA industry experience. Served as Director of Partner Relations at FundKite for 8 years (March 2017 to March 2025) before joining MonetaFi at launch. Previously founded ClickPayRent/ClickPay Services. Based in Miami, FL. Brings deep insight into the funding lifecycle and ISO/broker channel management.

news.h: MonetaFi Launches with Industry Veterans to Streamline MCA Funding
news.d: MonetaFi launched as a new MCA venture offering same-day funding, streamlined underwriting, and a partner-first approach. Led by industry veterans with decades of combined experience.

news.h: MonetaFi Targets Same-Day Funding Up to $2M
news.d: New MCA funder offers same-day business funding when applying before 2PM ET, approvals up to $750K standard and up to $2M, with funding available in all 50 states.

news.h: MonetaFi Opens ISO Partner Program
news.d: Company actively recruiting ISOs, MCA brokers, referral agents, CPAs, and consultants with high-performance funding solutions designed to increase approvals and speed closings.

leaders.bg: Co-founded Gulf Coast Business Credit in 2000 as Chief Operating Officer. University of Mississippi (Ole Miss) BBA in Banking & Finance (1988-1992). Attended St. Paul's School in Covington, LA. Began career as Senior Credit Analyst at Premier Bank/Bank One (1992-1996), then VP Business Development at KBK Financial (1996-2000). Appointed President and CEO in 2011. 25 years building GCBC into a national factoring leader.

25+ years in sales, factoring, and asset-based lending. Texas A&M graduate. Appointed to International Factoring Association (IFA) Advisory Board for a two-year term. Manages national team of sales, underwriting, and marketing leaders. Responsible for new, organic, and acquisition originations. Wade Hladky praised her for 14 years of industry knowledge and unmatched work ethic at GCBC.

Vice President of Business Development at GCBC based in Atlanta, GA since 2009. Specializes in staffing and transportation factoring. Recently closed a $7M working capital facility for a California staffing company. Regularly attends CSP Annual Staffing & Recruiting Conference and other industry events. Also handles oilfield transportation deals.

Based in San Antonio, TX. Joined GCBC in June 2021. Previously VP at The Bank of San Antonio and Business Development Executive at InstaPay. Also held roles at Powerfunding and USGP specializing in staffing solutions for government contracts. Expanding GCBC's Texas market footprint.
Leads credit analysis and underwriting team at Gulf Coast Business Credit. Key decision-maker for underwriting automation and credit assessment tools across the GCBC operation.

news.h: GCBC Celebrates 25th Anniversary
news.d: Gulf Coast Business Credit marks 25 years as the factoring, AR finance, and ABL division of Gulf Coast Bank & Trust Co., with offices across TX, GA, AR, AL, and AZ.

news.h: Meg Roberson Appointed to IFA Advisory Board
news.d: GCBC SVP Meg Roberson joined the International Factoring Association's Advisory Board for a two-year term to help broaden public understanding of factoring.

news.h: GCBC Implements Bayside CADENCE for Factoring
news.d: Gulf Coast Business Credit implemented Bayside's CADENCE platform to administer its business-to-business lending operations, modernizing its factoring technology stack.

news.h: GCBC Closes 43 New Deals in Strong Q3
news.d: Company closed 43 new AR factoring and ABL deals in Q3 including a $4M working capital facility for a Louisiana staffing company.

leaders.bg: Transitioned from eCommerce founder to fintech pioneer. CEO of Cashbloom from October 2008 to October 2023, then co-founded Likety in May 2024. Previously at Merchant Resources International. Built Likety around speed and understanding of small online business needs after running his own wellness eCommerce brand. Featured in Rebuy community spotlight and hosted AMA with Rebuy eCommerce community.

Founded The Merchant Solutions in 2006 at age 20 with seed capital from his father. CEO and Chairman of TMS offering POS systems, gateway accounts, ACH billing. Founded Hubwallet in 2018 for appointment management and payment processing across beauty, food, retail, and restaurant sectors. Deep merchant services and payment processing expertise spanning nearly two decades.
Business Development at Peak Finance in Woodland Hills, CA, a mortgage financing company offering conforming and non-conforming lending solutions. Handles BD and operations at Likety.

Based in Oxnard, California. 3+ years at American Merchant Services. Previously at Rair Capital, Cash Buoy, and Fundomate. Has negotiated with 400+ lending relationships including niche markets like cannabis-specific lenders. Recently joined Likety's partner development team.

news.h: Likety Launches as eCommerce-Focused Funding Platform
news.d: New fintech offers fast, flexible funding for eCommerce stores and small businesses, founded by former eCommerce operator who experienced borrower pain firsthand.

news.h: Nima Shamsili Featured in Rebuy Community Spotlight
news.d: Likety CEO highlighted for helping eCommerce founders access funding, sharing his journey from running a wellness brand to building a fintech company.

news.h: Likety Expands Partner Development Team
news.d: Company welcomed Ray Felts to the team for partner development, bringing 400+ lending relationships to expand Likety's broker and partner network.

leaders.bg: Founded United Capital Source nearly 20 years ago. Co-Chairman of SBFA Broker Council alongside James Webster of National Business Capital. Forbes Finance Council member and YEC (Young Entrepreneur Council) member. Won National Commercial Loan Broker of the Year 2019. UCS made Inc. 5000 in 2015 and 2017. Regularly quoted by NYT, Bloomberg, WSJ, Forbes, LegalZoom. Published 2025 LegalZoom interview on small business lending trends.
Runs day-to-day operations at United Capital Source. Limited public information available on background and career history.
Leads marketing strategy and brand positioning for United Capital Source. Limited public information available — may have since departed the company.
Drives strategic initiatives and business development partnerships at United Capital Source. Note: UCS management team lists Lacey Bende as Controller.

news.h: Jared Weitz Shares 2025 Small Business Lending Outlook on LegalZoom
news.d: UCS CEO provided detailed interview on getting small business loans in 2025, discussing innovative financing solutions as federal support programs phase out.

news.h: UCS CEO Named Forbes Finance Council Member
news.d: Jared Weitz contributes expert commentary on fintech and small business financing topics through Forbes Finance Council membership.

news.h: SBFA Broker Council Continues Industry Advocacy
news.d: Weitz serves as co-chairman alongside James Webster, representing broker interests in the small business finance industry through the SBFA nonprofit.

leaders.bg: University of Michigan BA in Economics (Magna Cum Laude). JD from Brooklyn Law School. Previously SVP of Revenue and Funder Partnerships at Lendio. CEO of BusinessBounce. Member at OnTarget Ventures and Premium Capital Funding. Led a $3B US mortgage firm. Built Big Think Capital to $1B+ funded across 25,000+ businesses with 110 employees.

Bryant University graduate with full lacrosse scholarship. Division-1 Captain and All-American athlete. With Big Think Capital since its inception, instrumental in company growth. Previously Sales Manager at national telecommunications company where he regularly achieved President's Club status. Drives revenue streams including syndication investment platform.

Marquette University graduate (2012-2016). Previously at Thomson Reuters as Client Specialist covering Wealth, Interest Rates, Credit, EM, and DCM. Also Go To Market Associate within Financial & Risk at Thomson Reuters. Manager of Customer Success in Wealth Management at Refinitiv. Now drives all strategic deal-making and partnership offerings at Big Think Capital.

Information Security degree holder. Leads enterprise IT strategy, systems architecture, and digital innovation at Big Think Capital. Lead Salesforce architect and administrator for platform automation and custom development. Heads company's AI initiatives, building and deploying ML pipelines, LLMs, and intelligent document processing for lead engagement, underwriting ops, and revenue workflows. Background in device repair, system integration, server deployment, and network engineering.

20 years Fortune 100 marketing experience. NYU Stern MBA and University of Leicester BS. Previously SVP at New York Life, roles at Deutsche Bank and JPMorgan Chase. Appointed CMO at Big Think Capital in March 2024 via BusinessWire announcement. Has since moved to CMO role at Napoli Shkolnik law firm. During tenure, led brand, communications, merchant marketing, and partner marketing.

news.h: Big Think Capital Ranked #19 Fortune Best Small Workplaces 2025
news.d: Company recognized as one of the best small workplaces in America, also ranked #30 on Fortune's Best Small and Medium Workplaces in Financial Services & Insurance.

news.h: Big Think Capital Resolves Litigation with Centrex and Forth
news.d: Data incident litigation with Centrex and Forth resolved in California federal court. Big Think acknowledged the breach was caused by malicious third-party actors not associated with Centrex or Forth.

news.h: Big Think Capital Appoints Ami Dviri as CMO
news.d: Company hired 20-year Fortune 100 marketing veteran from NY Life, JPMorgan Chase, and Deutsche Bank to lead all marketing functions.

news.h: Big Think Capital Surpasses $1B Funded
news.d: Company milestone of over $1 billion in business financing delivered to more than 25,000 clients nationwide since founding.

leaders.bg: 20 years in real estate-secured lending. Hofstra University graduate. Previously at Deutsche Bank. Former Head of ISO Relations at World Business Lenders. Co-founded LoanGeek in April 2023 after 13 years managing originations at a boutique commercial lending firm. Led company to win 2025 NPLA Broker of the Year award. Built LiveDeal portal connecting investors with 250+ lending partners nationwide. Featured in TechBullion interview on transforming real estate lending.

University of Arizona, Eller College of Management. Founder and CEO of 1West Finance (since 2017), which operates LoanGeek for real estate financing, EquipLoan for equipment, and Flash for small business loans. Previously VP of Business Development at Seek Business Capital. Co-founded 1West with CTO Cheyne Pierce to facilitate small business loans.

MBA holder. Joined LoanGeek May 2025. Deep real estate tech partnership experience from roles at Privy (Sales Head of Partnerships), Entera, Waypoint, Unison Home Ownership Investors, Agentdesks, 42Floors, and CoStar Group. Responsible for building and maintaining lender partner relationships.

news.h: LoanGeek Awarded 2025 NPLA Broker of the Year
news.d: Named Broker of the Year by National Private Lenders Association at Scottsdale conference, recognizing excellence in broker leadership, client outcomes, and industry impact.

news.h: LoanGeek LiveDeal Portal Connects to 250+ Lenders
news.d: CEO Chris Pepe profiled on how the LiveDeal portal surfaces qualified scenarios for capital providers to filter by loan type, amount, property category, and geography.

news.h: Scott Kronzek Joins LoanGeek as Director of Partnerships
news.d: RE tech veteran from CoStar Group, Privy, and 42Floors joins to build LoanGeek's partnership ecosystem and lender network.

leaders.bg: Serial MCA founder based in Bethpage, NY. Previously founded Direct Merchant Funding, First Premier Funding, and worked at Imperial Advance. Active LinkedIn content creator. Participated in MCA debates on podcasts including The Art of SBA Lending (Episode 177). Involved in regulatory discussions around Texas HB 700 and 7(a) Loan Agent Oversight Act. Fund My Biz is BBB-listed and focused on same-day MCA funding.

news.h: John DiCanio Debates MCA Pros and Cons on Podcast
news.s: The Art of SBA Lending, Ep 177
news.d: Fund My Biz founder participated in MCA debate discussing pros, cons, misconceptions of MCA lending and the rise of stacking's impact on small businesses.

news.h: Fund My Biz Founder Discusses Regulatory Landscape
news.d: DiCanio engaged in discussions about Texas HB 700 and the 7(a) Loan Agent Oversight Act, demonstrating regulatory awareness in the MCA space.

leaders.bg: Leads Bridgeport Capital Services, the Coral Springs, FL factoring company established in 1999. Oversees all operations and strategic direction for the company which generated $9.6M in annual revenue in 2025. Specializes in AR factoring for small to medium-sized businesses.
President of Bridgeport Capital Services. Runs day-to-day operations. Helps refine underwriting for factoring clients. Family business operation alongside CEO Mark Rosenstein.

Executive Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer at Bridgeport Capital Services since December 2008. Previously VP at Capital Factors and held position at Westgate Financial. Over 17 years at Bridgeport Capital. Highly connected in the factoring and ABL industry.

Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer at Bridgeport Capital Services. Based in Pompano Beach, FL. Previously held positions at Bibby Financial Services (VP Credit), Merchant Capital Services LLC, and Capital Business Credit. Expertise in credit risk, process improvement, and customer service. Focus on operational throughput.

VP and Business Development Officer at Bridgeport Capital Services. Based in Miami-Fort Lauderdale area. Prolific content creator with 32 blog posts on Bridgeport Capital's website covering factoring topics. Phone: 561-325-8903. Active in client outreach and BD.

news.h: Bridgeport Capital Publishes 2025 AR Financing Trends
news.d: Company published thought leadership on 4 AR financing shifts every business should watch in 2025, emphasizing transparency, instant funding, and smarter underwriting.

news.h: Bridgeport Capital Highlights Digital Factoring Transformation
news.d: Published article on how technology is transforming financial services through digital factoring, allowing businesses to sell receivables online and receive fast funding.

news.h: Bridgeport Capital Expands Industry-Specific Programs
news.d: Now offering factoring programs built specifically for oil field operations, apparel/retail, and business services sectors with customized solutions.

leaders.bg: BA in Psychology and Business from Yeshiva University. Founded Fratello Capital as NYC direct MCA funder. Previously at Deerwood Real Estate Capital, Fairmont Capital, and Meridian Capital Group. Co-founded and serves as Managing Partner at Integra Real Estate Capital LLC, a commercial real estate finance advisory. 18+ years in commercial real estate finance. Featured at deBanked Miami 2024. Also active in commercial real estate capital markets advisory.

Queens College graduate (Bachelor's degree). Based in Lake Success, NY. Runs operations at Fratello Capital. ZoomInfo lists title as CEO, suggesting possible elevation from COO to CEO role. Key operations decision-maker for the NYC-based MCA funder.
Manages ISO partnerships and broker channel at Fratello Capital through the dedicated underwriting portal (fratellocapitalportal.com). Front-line contact for deal flow.

news.h: Russell Kimyagarov Attends deBanked Miami 2024
news.d: Fratello Capital founder represented the company at deBanked's Miami event, networking with industry peers in the MCA and alternative lending space.

news.h: Fratello Capital Operates Dedicated ISO Portal
news.d: Company maintains a dedicated underwriting portal for ISO partners, streamlining the submission and funding process for MCA deals.

leaders.bg: Founded Spring Funding as a direct MCA capital provider. Built an ISO-focused platform with approvals in as little as 1 hour, flexible remittance structures, and funding from $5,000 to $500,000. Emphasizes transparent model empowering ISOs to fund more deals and scale portfolios with same-day commissions.

news.h: Spring Funding Expands ISO Partner Program
news.d: Company continues to grow its ISO-focused platform offering same-day commissions, 1-hour approvals, and flexible remittance structures for broker partners.

leaders.bg: Co-founded Biz2Credit in 2007 with brother Ramit. Columbia University international business background. Crain's NY Business Entrepreneur of the Year 2011. Regularly quoted by NYT, Bloomberg, WSJ, Entrepreneur, American Banker, CNNMoney, MSNBC, Inc. Built dual-engine empire managing a few billion dollars in active loans with $100M+ annual recurring revenue. Combined Biz2Credit/Biz2X valuation approaching $15-20B. IPO planned for early 2027. Revealed vision for AI-powered lending future at University of Miami Business School in January 2025.

Co-founded Biz2Credit in 2007 with brother Rohit. 10+ years experience in financial services at Citibank and Xerox with considerable risk management expertise. Bachelor's in business management and master's in accounting. Heads company's credit and sales operations. Named alongside Rohit as Crain's NY Business Top Entrepreneurs 2011. One of America's top experts in small business lending.

Masters in Consultancy Management from BITS Pilani. Bachelor's in Computer Engineering from NSIT Delhi. 25+ years in digital transformation, AI, Big Data, and Data Science. Previously CTO and Head of Innovation Lab at Impetus Technologies. Heads Biz2X India operations. Recognized industry leader in AI, Big Data, and disruptive innovation. Frequent speaker at international technology conferences. Leading Biz2X's Columbia University AI partnership.

Columbia Business School MBA graduate and current lecturer there on strategic marketing and innovation. 20+ years leading B2B SaaS and fintech organizations. Wall Street Journal CMO Council member. Regular contributor to Forbes, Fast Company, and Entrepreneur. Built award-winning brands and scalable demand generation frameworks propelling companies beyond $400M in revenue. Driving AI-powered fintech strategy and enterprise adoption of Biz2X platform.

news.h: Biz2Credit Partners with Columbia University on $750B AI Initiative
news.d: Partnership with Columbia University to develop AI models that could cut loan approval times in half, increase lending volumes by 30%, and unlock up to $750B in private credit for US SMBs.

news.h: Biz2X Launches AI-Powered Digital Site Visits
news.d: New AI-enabled digital inspection application eliminates physical property verification and accelerates loan processing for financial institutions.

news.h: Biz2X Frontiers 2026 Conference in Miami
news.d: Ninth annual convening held January 28-29, 2026 in Miami, bringing together fintech and lending leaders.

news.h: FTC $33M Settlement Over PPP Processing Claims
news.d: Biz2Credit agreed to pay $33M to settle FTC charges of deceptively advertising 10-14 day PPP loan processing when actual average exceeded two months.

leaders.bg: Three decades of asset management, business development, and capital formation experience. Co-founded MPAM (MatlinPatterson Asset Management) in 2010. Early partner at Fortress Investment Group where he was President of the Hybrid (credit) business, playing primary role in growing AUM to over $40 billion. Also led Galway Advisors. Colby College graduate. Named to American Banker's Top 25 People Who Will Change Banking in 2025. Founded Newity to bring Wall Street knowledge to Main Street via technology.

CPA registered in Illinois and Michigan. CFA Charterholder. Master's in Accountancy from University of Notre Dame. Bachelor's in Finance from Michigan State University. Previously at Big Four firms EY and PwC in commercial lending, transaction advisory, audit, tax, and lender services. Co-founded Newity during COVID 2020. Named to American Banker's Top 25 People Who Will Change Banking in 2025. Leads all facets from loan originations and investment strategy to portfolio management.

news.h: Newity Co-CEOs Named American Banker Top 25 Visionaries 2025
news.d: David Cody and Luke LaHaie recognized on prestigious list of 25 People Who Will Change Banking in 2025 for their innovative approach to SBA 7(a) lending.

news.h: Newity Ranks #596 on Inc. 5000 List 2025
news.d: Company recognized as one of America's fastest-growing private companies, also named Deloitte Fast 500 honoree.

news.h: Newity Facilitates $326.56M in SBA Funding in 2025
news.d: Record-breaking year with 322,103 new members joining the Newity network and over $326M facilitated through Northeast Bank partnership.

news.h: Newity Navigates Major SBA SOP Rule Changes
news.d: Published guide for loan brokers on navigating June 2025 SBA SOP changes including new franchise eligibility requirements and collateral pledge rules.

leaders.bg: Head of ISO Relations at Thoro Corp. Accounting background with career in international finance. Featured in FunderIntel Q&A where she discussed Thoro Corp's transparent, boutique approach. Manages ISO partnerships with no in-house brokerage team. Based in Hallandale Beach, FL. Company incorporated April 2024, specializing in B-C paper MCA with funding up to $5M and terms up to 24 weeks. Also launched Thoro Payments for credit card processing.

news.h: FunderIntel Q&A Profiles Thoro Corp's Boutique Approach
news.d: Jacquelline Bogdanov discussed Thoro Corp's transparent, communication-first approach to MCA funding and ISO partnership management in an industry Q&A feature.

news.h: Thoro Corp Launches Thoro Payments Service
news.d: Company expanded beyond MCA to launch Thoro Payments, enabling clients to process credit card transactions alongside their funding relationships.

news.h: Thoro Corp Offers Same-Day Commissions to ISOs
news.d: Company announced same-day commission structure for ISO partners, differentiating in the competitive MCA broker channel.

leaders.bg: Yeshiva University graduate. Previously Partner at Capital Express. Built Rowan Advance to approximately 200 employees with $98M+ funded per quarter. Company focuses on revenue-based financing from $10K to $5M with factor rates from 1.28. ISO broker-focused distribution model with same-day commissions and commissions up to 12 points.
Manages financial operations and reporting at Rowan Advance. Key operational decision-maker in the family-run business. Oversees finance for the 200-person organization.

news.h: Rowan Advance Publishes 2026 MCA Trends Guide for ISOs
news.d: Company published guide on top MCA trends shaping 2026, advising ISOs on fast funding, smart technology, and strong partnerships.

news.h: Rowan Advance Group LLC vs DraftPros Litigation
news.d: Company filed breach of contract case regarding a March 2025 Sale of Future Receipts Agreement, indicating active portfolio enforcement.

leaders.bg: Previously President and Founder of Pearl Capital (2009-2012). Prior experience at New Era Lending. Based in Brooklyn with Miami operations. Deep MCA experience spanning over a decade. Built BizFund to 21-50 employees with $10-25M revenue, offering 90%+ approval rate and 24-48 hour turnaround. BizFund focuses on short-term 3-12 month funding for operational needs.

Progressed from VP ISO Relations to Head of Business Development, ISO Department at BizFund. Based in Miami (305 area code). Previously VP of Business Development at US MED Capital, an industry leader in healthcare small business financing. Manages strategic ISO partnerships, broker relationships, and underwriting communication to expand networks. Contact: 305-785-8564.
Manages day-to-day ISO broker relationships and deal flow at BizFund. Part of the ISO department handling partner communications and submissions.

news.h: BizFund Maintains High Approval Rates for SMBs
news.d: Company continues to offer 90%+ approval rates with 24-48 hour turnaround, focusing on recent business performance rather than credit history for MCA funding.

news.h: BizFund Expands ISO Department Leadership
news.d: Rikki Kopfstein promoted from VP ISO Relations to Head of Business Development for the ISO department, signaling growth in broker channel.

leaders.bg: BS from NYU Polytechnic School of Engineering. Previously Senior Network Architect at JPMorgan Chase designing network solutions. Senior Network Engineer at CIBC World Markets contributing to IT infrastructure management. Also Managing Partner at Premier Capital Funding LLC. Brings institutional technology and risk management background to MCA lending. Founded Fenix Capital Funding in October 2021.

Brooklyn-based attorney and Chief Legal Officer at Fenix Capital Funding. Previously Associate at Principal and held position at Maxim Group. Manages legal and compliance for MCA operations. Has provided sworn affidavits and verification statements in New York state court cases on behalf of Fenix Capital.

news.h: Fenix Capital Funding Maintains BBB A Rating
news.d: Brooklyn-based MCA funder continues to hold BBB A rating while providing merchant cash advances from $7,500 to $150,000 with 4-12 month terms.

news.h: Fenix Capital Active in New York Court Filings
news.d: Company pursuing breach of contract cases for receivables purchase agreements in New York courts, indicating active portfolio management and enforcement.

leaders.bg: Master of Arts from Fairleigh Dickinson University. Bachelor of Arts from Rabbinical College of America. Previously an underwriter at Funding For Merchants where he focused on small business capital funding with underwriting and syndication responsibilities. President of Fox Business Funding (also known as Fox Capital Group) since incorporation in May 2014. Based in Brooklyn. Company operates from Hollywood, FL with $4M annual revenue in 2025.

Based in Miami, FL. Chief Strategy Officer at Fox Business Funding. Previous experience at The Dr. George and Vivian Dean Collection, 3RDVISTA, and Day 28 Films. Handles competitive positioning and strategy for the MCA funder.

news.h: Fox Business Funding Continues ACH and MCA Operations
news.d: Company provides ACH advances and MCA in 1st and 2nd positions with funding up to $1M and 24-48 hour disbursement from Hollywood, FL headquarters.

news.h: Fox Business Funding Revenue Reaches $4M
news.d: The ~35-employee company based in Hollywood, FL reported $4M in annual revenue, continuing growth in ACH and MCA lending.

leaders.bg: Hofstra University Finance degree. Leads 800Funding's overall strategy from Miami, FL (20200 W Dixie Hwy). Emphasizes technology-driven efficiency in small business funding powered by artificial intelligence and advanced data analytics. Company offers MCA, invoice factoring, PO funding, and AR lines of credit.

news.h: 800Funding Emphasizes AI-Driven Alternative Financing
news.d: Miami-based funder highlights state-of-the-art solutions driven by artificial intelligence and advanced data analytics for small business funding.

news.h: 800Funding Expands Programs Beyond MCA
news.d: Company now offers invoice factoring, PO funding, and AR lines of credit alongside its core MCA product, serving businesses across multiple industries.
